meanings.definition: The transmission of information over long distances by electronic means.
meanings.sent1: Telecomms help people talk to each other even when they are far apart.
meanings.sent2: I work in telecomms and help connect people through phone calls and messages.
meanings.sent3: The telecomms were so busy today that the messages got tangled up like a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: In the world of telecomms, information travels faster than a speeding train.
meanings.sent5: The importance of telecomms in our lives is like the air we breathe, essential and invisible.

meanings.definition: The branch of technology dealing with telecommunications.
meanings.sent1: Learning about telecomms involves understanding how phones and computers communicate.
meanings.sent2: Telecomms experts are always working on new ways to improve our connections.
meanings.sent3: The telecomms class was so interesting that even the computers seemed to be listening.
meanings.sent4: In the vast world of telecomms, innovation is the key to unlocking endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The evolution of telecomms has transformed the way we interact with each other, shaping our future.
